ground_truth: With one hand, Harry stems the flow of blood from Snape's neck and holds the phial to Snape's cheek, catching his tears in it. Harry removes the phial from Snape's cheek, grips it, as Snape studies Harry's face. Harry's lips tremble, Snape's eyes glaze over, and his head lolls to one side. Hermione briefly glances at Ron, then looks down at the floor. Harry stares at the dead Snape as the surface of the water starts to ripple and the building trembles. Harry steadies himself against the glass wall, while Ron holds onto the door and Hermione clasps her hands to her ears. Fred Weasley is injured as Hermione and Ron, distressed, stand a little way behind Harry. It's still dark, and pockets of fire burn throughout the school and grounds as the three friends make their way back up the path to the courtyard. Ron pushes open the doors of the Great Hall, and the three are confronted by piles of rubble. Further in, they see students and staff; two students carry someone out on a stretcher. Ron spots something and hurries forward with Hermione following, while Harry stands frozen in the doorway. Slughorn is tending to the wounded Filch and turns. Harry passes a long line of people being treated, witnessing Professor Trelawney and Padma Patil pull a blanket over a dead body. He sees the Weasleys up ahead, with George weeping, clinging to his father, and desperately hugging Ron. Fleur comforts Bill, and Molly, distraught, kneels beside Fred's body, stroking his hair. Ron joins Her, sobbing helplessly while Hermione stands at a distance. Harry watches the grieving family and glances to his left, seeing the bodies of Nymphadora and Remus lying side by side on stretchers, Remus' little finger resting on hers. Professor McGonagall limps towards Harry, who, without seeing her, turns and strides out of the Great Hall. He enters Dumbledore's old, undamaged office; as he steps further in, covered doors to his right open of their own accord and a stone pedestal slides out. Harry crosses to the pedestal, lifts out a shallow silver basin, and gently spins it through the air. It floats towards the desk at the far side of the room, and he follows the spinning Pensieve to the desk where it lands lightly. Holding the phial containing Snape's tears, Harry removes the stopper and empties the contents into the basin, causing misty black swirls to appear in the Pensieve. Harry sinks his face into the bowl, and the swirling black clears to reveal a meadow with two young girls, Lily and her sister Petunia, facing each other. Lily opens her palm to reveal a daisy growing in it, and an equally young Severus Snape emerges from a large tree trunk as Petunia runs off.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: With one palm, Harry stems the flux of gore from Snape's throat and holds the vial to Snape's cheek, catching his weeping in it. Harry removes the vial from Snape's cheek, grips it, as Snape examines Harry's countenance. Harry's lips quiver, Snape's eyes glaze over, and his head lolls to one side. Hermione briefly peeks at Ron, then glances down at the ground. Harry gazes at the deceased Snape as the surface of the liquid starts to ripple and the construction shakes. Harry braces himself against the glass barrier, while Ron clutches onto the entrance and Hermione clasps her palms to her ears. Fred Weasley is wounded as Hermione and Ron, distressed, stand a little way behind Harry. It's still dim, and pockets of blaze burn throughout the institution and grounds as the three comrades make their way back up the path to the courtyard. Ron pushes open the portals of the Great Hall, and the three are confronted by heaps of debris. Further in, they observe scholars and faculty; two scholars bear someone out on a stretcher. Ron spots something and rushes forward with Hermione following, while Harry stands petrified in the entryway. Slughorn is tending to the injured Filch and rotates. Harry passes a long queue of individuals being treated, witnessing Professor Trelawney and Padma Patil pull a cover over a lifeless body. He sees the Weasleys up ahead, with George lamenting, clinging to his father, and desperately embracing Ron. Fleur consoles Bill, and Molly, distraught, kneels beside Fred's form, stroking his locks. Ron joins her, sobbing helplessly while Hermione stands at a distance. Harry observes the mourning family and glances to his left, seeing the figures of Nymphadora and Remus lying side by side on stretchers, Remus' little digit resting on hers. Professor McGonagall limps towards Harry, who, without noticing her, turns and strides out of the Great Hall. He enters Dumbledore's antique, undamaged chamber; as he steps further in, covered portals to his right open of their own accord and a stone dais slides out. Harry crosses to the dais, lifts out a shallow silver basin, and gently spins it through the ether. It floats towards the desk at the far side of the chamber, and he follows the spinning Pensieve to the desk where it lands lightly. Holding the vial containing Snape's weeping, Harry removes the stopper and empties the contents into the basin, causing misty black eddies to appear in the Pensieve. Harry sinks his visage into the bowl, and the swirling black clears to reveal a field with two young girls, Lily and her sibling Petunia, facing each other. Lily opens her palm to reveal a bloom growing in it, and an equally young Severus Snape emerges from a large tree trunk as Petunia flees.

The phial is removed from Snape's cheek by Harry, and it is gripped as Snape studies Harry's face. Harry's lips tremble, Snape's eyes glaze over, and his head lolls to one side. Up ahead, the Weasleys are seen by him, with George weeping, clinging to his father, and desperately hugging Ron. The pedestal is crossed to by Harry, and a shallow silver basin is lifted out by him and gently spun through the air. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: While stemming blood from Snape's neck with one hand, Harry catches his tears in a phial. Removing it, he grips the phial as Snape studies Harry's face before dying. Hermione glances at Ron, then at the floor, while Harry watches Snape. The water ripples, and the building shakes. Harry steadies himself against a glass wall, Ron grips the door, and Hermione covers her ears. Fred Weasley is injured as Ron and Hermione, distressed, stand behind Harry. It's dark, with fires burning in the school and grounds as they head to the courtyard. Ron opens the Great Hall doors to piles of rubble. They see students and staff inside; two students carry someone out on a stretcher. Ron spots something and rushes forward with Hermione, while Harry stands frozen. Slughorn tends to Filch's wounds. Harry passes a line of injured people, seeing Trelawney and Padma Patil cover a dead body. He sees the Weasleys, with George weeping and hugging Ron, while Fleur comforts Bill. Molly, distraught, kneels by Fred's body, stroking his hair. Ron joins her, sobbing as Hermione stands back. Harry watches the grieving family and sees Nymphadora and Remus’s bodies on stretchers, their fingers touching. Professor McGonagall limps toward him, but Harry, without seeing her, leaves the Great Hall. He enters Dumbledore's undamaged office; doors open as a stone pedestal slides out. Harry lifts a silver basin, spins it in the air, and it lands on the desk. Holding Snape's phial, he empties it into the basin, creating misty black swirls. Harry sinks his face into it, revealing a meadow with young Lily and her sister Petunia. Lily shows a daisy growing in her palm, and a young Severus Snape emerges from a tree as Petunia runs off.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry stems Snape's neck wound while collecting his tears in a phial. As Snape dies, Hermione glances at Ron, and they look down. Harry observes Snape's body, the water ripples, and the building shakes. Harry steadies himself, Ron holds the door, and Hermione covers her ears. Injured Fred is nearby as Hermione and Ron stand back. In darkness, fires burn across the grounds as they return to the courtyard. Ron opens the Great Hall doors to rubble and sees students and staff aiding the injured. Ron hurries with Hermione, leaving Harry frozen. Slughorn helps Filch, and Harry sees Trelawney and Padma cover a body. Weeping George clings to his father, hugging Ron. Fleur comforts Bill, and Molly mourns Fred with Ron sobbing alongside. Hermione stands back as Harry sees Nymphadora and Remus. McGonagall limps towards Harry, who leaves without noticing her. In Dumbledore's office, a pedestal emerges, and Harry lifts a silver basin. He releases Snape's tears into the Pensieve, revealing a meadow with young Lily and Petunia. Lily shows a daisy, and young Severus emerges as Petunia runs off.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
With one firm hand, Harry attempts to stem the steady flow of blood from Snape's neck. Meanwhile, with the other hand, he carefully holds the phial close to Snape's cheek, deftly catching the significant drops of his tears in it. Once he finishes, Harry meticulously removes the phial from Snape's cheek, gripping it tightly as Snape, with effort, studies Harry's face. There is a noticeable tremble in Harry's lips, reflecting the intense emotions of the moment, while Snape's eyes grow increasingly glazed and unfocused, his head eventually lolling to one side. Hermione, feeling a mix of emotions, briefly glances over at Ron, then looks down at the floor in sorrow. Harry, overcome with emotion, continues to stare at the lifeless Snape as the surface of the nearby water begins to ripple and undulate, and the entire building around them trembles ominously. Harry, sensing the instability, steadies himself against the glass wall, while Ron holds firmly onto the door, and Hermione, overwhelmed, clasps her hands tightly to her ears to block out the noise. 

Nearby, Fred Weasley is severely injured, and as Hermione and Ron, visibly distressed and shaken, stand a little way behind Harry, it remains dark outside. Pockets of fire still burn throughout the school grounds as the three friends make their way back up the familiar path leading to the courtyard. Ron, summoning his strength, pushes open the heavy doors of the Great Hall, and the trio is immediately confronted by large piles of rubble scattered everywhere. As they venture further inside, they observe students and staff in various states of disarray; they notice two students carefully carrying someone out on a stretcher. Ron, alert and attentive, spots something significant and quickly hurries forward with Hermione following closely behind, while Harry stands frozen in the doorway, paralyzed by the scene before him. Slughorn is seen attending to the wounded Filch, pausing to turn and survey the chaos. 

Harry passes a long line of people being treated, witnessing the somber sight of Professor Trelawney and Padma Patil gently pulling a blanket over a lifeless body. Ahead, he sees the Weasley family, with George openly weeping, clinging desperately to his father and fiercely hugging Ron. Fleur stands nearby, offering comfort to Bill, and Molly, heartbroken and distraught, kneels beside Fred's body, softly stroking his hair with loving care. Ron joins his mother, sobbing helplessly while Hermione stands at a respectful distance, taking in the scene. Harry observes the grieving family, the depth of their sorrow poignant, and then glances to his left, seeing the bodies of Nymphadora and Remus lying closely side by side on stretchers, Remus’ little finger touching hers gently.

Professor McGonagall, limping with visible discomfort, makes her way towards Harry, who, lost in his thoughts and without noticing her presence, turns and strides purposefully out of the Great Hall. He enters Dumbledore's old, miraculously undamaged office; as he steps further inside, covered doors to his right surprisingly open of their own accord, and suddenly, a stone pedestal smoothly slides out. Harry makes his way to the pedestal, carefully lifting out a shallow silver basin and gently spinning it through the air. It floats gracefully towards the desk at the far side of the room, and he follows, watching as the spinning Pensieve lands lightly on the desk. Holding the phial that contains Snape's precious tears, Harry removes the stopper with care and pours the contents into the basin, instantly causing misty black swirls to manifest in the Pensieve. Harry then sinks his face into the bowl, and as his vision clears, the swirling black gives way to reveal a serene meadow with two young girls, Lily and her sister Petunia, facing each other. Lily, brimming with a youthful sense of wonder, opens her palm to reveal a vibrant daisy growing in it, and an equally young Severus Snape emerges from behind a large tree trunk as Petunia, startled, runs off into the distance.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
With one firm, determined hand, Harry tries to stem the relentless and steady flow of blood from Snape's neck, applying pressure with grim resolve. Meanwhile, with his other hand, he carefully holds the small phial close to Snape's cheek, deftly capturing the significant, essential drops of his tears in it with precise movements. Once he completes this crucial task, Harry meticulously removes the phial from Snape's pale cheek, gripping it tightly and securely as Snape, with visible effort, studies Harry's face with a deep, unfocused gaze. There is a noticeable tremble in Harry's lips, reflecting the intense emotions of the moment, while Snape's eyes grow increasingly glazed and unfocused, his head eventually lolling to one side, indicating his weakening state. Hermione, feeling a mix of complex emotions, briefly glances over at Ron, then looks down at the floor in profound sorrow. Harry, overcome with a strong wave of emotion, continues to stare at the lifeless Snape as the surface of the nearby water begins to ripple and undulate, and the entire building around them trembles ominously with instability. Harry, sensing the uncertainty, steadies himself by leaning against the glass wall, while Ron holds firmly onto the door for support, and Hermione, overwhelmed, clasps her hands tightly to her ears in an attempt to block out the noise. 

Nearby, Fred Weasley lies severely injured, and as Hermione and Ron, visibly distressed and shaken, stand a little way behind Harry, it remains dark outside, lending an eerie atmosphere. Pockets of fire still burn ominously throughout the school grounds as the three friends make their way back up the familiar path leading to the courtyard, retracing their steps with heavy hearts. Ron, summoning his strength and resolve, pushes open the heavy doors of the Great Hall, and the trio is immediately confronted by large piles of rubble scattered everywhere in a chaotic mess. As they venture further inside, they observe students and staff in various states of disarray; they notice two students carefully carrying someone out on a stretcher, a somber reminder of the night's events. Ron, alert and attentive, spots something significant amid the chaos and quickly hurries forward, intent and determined, with Hermione closely following behind, while Harry stands frozen in the doorway, paralyzed by the overwhelming scene before him. Slughorn is seen attentively attending to the wounded Filch, pausing momentarily to turn and survey the chaotic scene with a look of concern. 

Harry passes a long line of people being treated, witnessing the somber sight of Professor Trelawney and Padma Patil gently pulling a blanket over a lifeless body, a poignant scene that captures the gravity of the situation. Ahead, he sees the Weasley family, with George openly weeping, clinging desperately to his father and fiercely hugging Ron in a display of shared grief. Fleur stands nearby, offering comfort and support to Bill, while Molly, heartbroken and distraught, kneels beside Fred's body, softly stroking his hair with loving care and tenderness. Ron joins his mother, sobbing helplessly in his grief, while Hermione stands at a respectful distance, taking in the emotional scene with silent empathy. Harry observes the grieving family, deeply moved by the depth of their sorrow, and then glances to his left, seeing the bodies of Nymphadora and Remus lying closely side by side on stretchers, Remus’ little finger gently touching hers in a tender gesture.

Professor McGonagall, limping with visible discomfort and determination, makes her way towards Harry, who, lost in his thoughts and without noticing her presence, turns and strides purposefully out of the Great Hall, determined to fulfill his mission. He enters Dumbledore's old, miraculously undamaged office; as he steps further inside, covered doors to his right surprisingly open of their own accord, and suddenly, a stone pedestal smoothly slides out with an almost magical grace. Harry makes his way to the pedestal, carefully lifting out a shallow silver basin and gently sending it spinning through the air. It floats gracefully towards the desk at the far side of the room, and he follows, watching as the spinning Pensieve lands lightly on the desk, ready to reveal its secrets. Holding the phial that contains Snape's precious tears, Harry removes the stopper with care and pours the contents into the basin, instantly causing misty black swirls to manifest hypnotically in the Pensieve. Harry then sinks his face into the bowl, and as his vision clears, the swirling black gives way to reveal a serene meadow with two young girls, Lily and her sister Petunia, facing each other in a scene from the past. Lily, brimming with a youthful sense of wonder and excitement, opens her palm to reveal a vibrant daisy growing in it, and an equally young Severus Snape emerges from behind a large tree trunk as Petunia, startled, runs off into the distance, leaving the magical moment behind.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: With careful precision, Harry firmly presses one hand against Snape's neck, attempting to halt the flow of blood, while simultaneously holding a phial close to Snape's cheek with the other hand, meticulously catching each tear that falls. Once the phial has collected the tears, Harry removes it from Snape's cheek and grips it securely, feeling the weight of the collected memories, as Snape takes a moment to study Harry's face intently. Meanwhile, Harry's lips begin to tremble slightly with emotion as Snape's eyes gradually glaze over, signaling the loss of consciousness, and his head lolls weakly to one side. Observing this, Hermione briefly exchanges a glance with Ron, then directs her gaze downward, focusing on the floor with a somber expression. At this moment, Harry continues to stare at Snape's lifeless form, his attention momentarily diverted as the surface of the nearby water starts to ripple gently, indicating a disturbance, and the building surrounding them trembles subtly. To steady himself amidst the trembling, Harry places a steadying hand against the glass wall while Ron braces himself against the door for support, and Hermione clasps her hands tightly over her ears to muffle the surrounding noise. In the chaos, Fred Weasley is injured, and Hermione and Ron, visibly distressed, stand a short distance behind Harry, grappling with the unfolding tragedy. The scene remains blanketed in darkness, with pockets of fire casting intermittent glows throughout the school and the surrounding grounds, as the three friends start their journey back up the path leading to the courtyard. As they approach the entrance, Ron pushes open the heavy doors of the Great Hall, and the trio is immediately confronted by a staggering sight of piles of rubble strewn across the space. As they venture further inside, they observe a somber gathering of students and staff; amidst them, two students can be seen carrying an injured comrade out on a stretcher. Suddenly, Ron notices something that catches his attention, prompting him to hurry forward with determination, with Hermione closely following in his footsteps, while Harry remains momentarily frozen in the doorway, surveying the scene. Nearby, Slughorn is diligently tending to the wounded Filch, but he turns toward the newcomers upon noticing their presence. As Harry walks through the scene, he passes by a long line of people receiving treatment, taking note of Professor Trelawney and Padma Patil in the midst of their solemn task of pulling a blanket over a deceased individual. His attention then shifts to the Weasley family situated up ahead; he witnesses George weeping openly, clinging to his father in a moment of shared grief, and desperately embracing Ron for comfort. Meanwhile, Fleur stands by offering solace to Bill, and Molly, overwhelmed with sorrow, kneels beside the lifeless body of Fred, gently stroking his hair. Ron joins his mother at Fred's side, overcome with helpless sobs, while Hermione stands a short distance away, quietly observing the family's grief. As Harry watches this poignant scene, he glances to his left and is met with the heart-wrenching sight of the bodies of Nymphadora and Remus lying side by side on stretchers, Remus' little finger resting tenderly on hers, signifying their eternal bond. At that moment, Professor McGonagall approaches limping toward Harry, but he, preoccupied with his thoughts, does not notice her presence and instead turns decisively, striding out of the Great Hall with a purposeful gait. He soon arrives at Dumbledore's old, undamaged office, and as he steps further inside, covered doors to his right slowly open of their own accord, revealing a stone pedestal that slides out smoothly. Without hesitation, Harry crosses the room to the pedestal, carefully lifts out a shallow silver basin, and with a gentle flick, sends it spinning gracefully through the air. He follows the spinning Pensieve as it moves towards the desk situated at the far side of the room, where it eventually lands lightly and comes to rest. Holding the phial that contains Snape's valuable tears, Harry methodically removes the stopper and pours the entire contents into the basin, watching intently as misty black swirls begin to form within the Pensieve. As the swirling black transforms, Harry leans forward and submerges his face into the bowl, becoming immersed in the memories, which gradually clear to reveal a serene meadow where two young girls, Lily and her sister Petunia, stand facing each other. Within this vivid memory, Lily opens her palm to reveal a small daisy magically growing in it, and from the distance, an equally young Severus Snape emerges cautiously from a large tree trunk, observing the scene, while Petunia, startled, runs off, leaving Lily and Severus behind in the idyllic landscape.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry staunches Snape's bleeding while collecting his tears in a phial. As Snape studies Harry, the life fades from his eyes, and Harry watches his head fall to one side. Hermione and Ron share a somber glance, and Hermione looks down. Amidst the trembling building and rippling water, Harry braces against the glass wall, with Ron and Hermione holding on for stability. They join the injured Fred Weasley and, under cover of darkness and scattered fires, make their way to the Great Hall, stepping around debris. Inside, students and staff attend to the injured, and two students carry someone on a stretcher. Ron rushes forward at the sight of the Weasley family, with Hermione close behind, while Harry remains in the doorway, observing the aftermath. Slughorn tends Filch's wounds; Harry witnesses Trelawney and Padma Patil covering a body with a blanket. He sees George weeping, embraced by his father, while Fleur comforts Bill. Molly kneels beside Fred, tenderly stroking his hair; Ron joins her in grief as Hermione stands back. Harry notices the bodies of Nymphadora and Remus nearby, their fingers lightly touching. Without acknowledging Professor McGonagall as she approaches, Harry turns and exits the hall. Entering Dumbledore's untouched office, he approaches a stone pedestal revealed by opening doors. He lifts the Pensieve, sending it toward the desk. There, he opens the phial, pouring Snape's tears into the basin and creating swirling black mist. Leaning over the bowl, Harry peers into the Pensieve, which reveals a meadow where young Lily and Petunia stand. Lily displays her magic by growing a daisy from her palm, and young Severus Snape appears as Petunia runs away.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: With one hand, Harry stems the flow of blood from Snape's neck, who had been a complex figure in Harry's life, and holds the phial to Snape's cheek, catching his tears in it. Harry removes the phial from Snape's cheek, grips it, as Snape studies Harry's face with a mix of resignation and a final glimpse of trust. Harry's lips tremble, Snape's eyes glaze over, and his head lolls to one side, reminiscent of the tragic ends often witnessed in the battles of Hogwarts. Hermione, known for her quick intellect and bravery, briefly glances at Ron, then looks down at the floor, overwhelmed by the gravity of the moment. Harry stares at the dead Snape as the surface of the water starts to ripple, a sign of the magical disruptions in the castle, and the building trembles. Harry steadies himself against the glass wall that echoes the chaos outside, while Ron holds onto the door and Hermione clasps her hands to her ears, a futile attempt to block out the sounds of the ongoing battle. Fred Weasley, one of the beloved Weasley twins known for their humor, is injured as Hermione and Ron, distressed and fearful for their friend's life, stand a little way behind Harry. It's still dark, and pockets of fire burn throughout the school and grounds, remnants of the fierce conflict that took place, as the three friends make their way back up the path to the courtyard. Ron pushes open the doors of the Great Hall, a place once filled with joyous feasts, and the three are confronted by piles of rubble, a testament to the night's destruction. Further in, they see students and staff; two students carry someone out on a stretcher, a stark reminder of the losses endured. Ron spots something amidst the chaos and hurries forward with Hermione following, while Harry stands frozen in the doorway, absorbing the scene of devastation. Slughorn, the potions master with a talent for spotting potential, is tending to the wounded caretaker Filch and turns as Harry passes a long line of people being treated, witnessing Professor Trelawney and Padma Patil pull a blanket over a dead body. He sees the Weasleys up ahead, a family known for their unity and love, with George weeping, clinging to his father, and desperately hugging Ron. Fleur, who married into this tight-knit family, comforts Bill, and Molly, distraught, kneels beside Fred's body, stroking his hair in the tender way only a mother can. Ron joins her, sobbing helplessly while Hermione, understanding their need for privacy, stands at a distance. Harry watches the grieving family and glances to his left, seeing the bodies of Nymphadora, a brave Auror, and Remus, his former Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, lying side by side on stretchers, Remus' little finger resting on hers, symbolizing their enduring love even in death. Professor McGonagall, the stalwart leader of Gryffindor, limps towards Harry, who, without seeing her, turns and strides out of the Great Hall. He enters Dumbledore's old, undamaged office, a place filled with memories of guidance and wisdom; as he steps further in, covered doors to his right open of their own accord and a stone pedestal slides out, revealing the magical security of the room. Harry crosses to the pedestal, lifts out a shallow silver basin, known as the Pensieve, and gently spins it through the air. It floats towards the desk at the far side of the room, and he follows the spinning Pensieve to the desk where it lands lightly. Holding the phial containing Snape's tears, a symbol of his complex legacy, Harry removes the stopper and empties the contents into the basin, causing misty black swirls to appear in the Pensieve. Harry sinks his face into the bowl, and the swirling black clears to reveal a meadow with two young girls, Lily, his mother, and her sister Petunia, facing each other. Lily opens her palm to reveal a daisy growing in it, showcasing her natural magical talent, and an equally young Severus Snape emerges from a large tree trunk as Petunia runs off, setting the stage for the intertwined destinies that followed.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: With one hand Harry stems the flow of blood from Snape's neck and holds the phial to Snape's cheek catching his tears in it. Harry removes the phial from Snape's cheek grips it as Snape studies Harry's face. Harry's lips tremble Snape's eyes glaze over and his head lolls to one side. Hermione briefly glances at Ron then looks down at the floor. Harry stares at the dead Snape as the surface of the water starts to ripple and the building trembles. Harry steadies himself against the glass wall while Ron holds onto the door and Hermione clasps her hands to her ears. Fred Weasley is injured as Hermione and Ron distressed stand a little way behind Harry. It is still dark and pockets of fire burn throughout the school and grounds as the three friends make their way back up the path to the courtyard. Ron pushes open the doors of the Great Hall and the three are confronted by piles of rubble. Further in they see students and staff. two students carry someone out on a stretcher. Ron spots something and hurries forward with Hermione following while Harry stands frozen in the doorway. Slughorn is tending to the wounded Filch and turns. Harry passes a long line of people being treated witnessing Professor Trelawney and Padma. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Patil pull a blanket over a dead body. He sees the Weasleys up ahead with George weeping clinging to his father and desperately hugging Ron. Fleur comforts Bill and Molly distraught kneels beside Fred's body stroking his hair. Ron joins Her sobbing helplessly while Hermione stands at a distance. Harry watches the grieving family and glances to his left seeing the bodies of Nymphadora and Remus lying side by side on stretchers. Remus' little finger resting on hers. Professor McGonagall limps towards Harry who without seeing her turns and strides out of the Great Hall. He enters Dumbledore's old undamaged office as he steps further in covered doors to his right open of their own accord and a stone pedestal slides out. Harry crosses to the pedestal lifts out a shallow silver basin and gently spins it through the air. It floats towards the desk at the far side of the room and he follows the spinning Pensieve to the desk where it lands lightly. Holding the phial containing Snape's tears Harry removes the stopper and empties the contents into the basin causing misty black swirls to appear in the Pensieve. Harry sinks his face into the bowl and the swirling black clears to reveal a meadow with two young girls Lily and her sister Petunia facing each other. Lily opens her palm to reveal a daisy growing in it and an equally young Severus. Snape emerges from a large tree trunk as Petunia runs off.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: With one hand Harry stems the flow of blood from Snape's neck and holds the phial to Snape's cheek catching his tears in it. Harry removes the phial from Snape's cheek grips it as Snape studies Harry's face. Harry's lips tremble Snape's eyes glaze over and his head lolls to one side. Hermione briefly glances at Ron then looks down at the floor. Harry stares at the dead Snape as the surface of the water starts to ripple and the building trembles. Harry steadies himself against the glass wall while Ron holds onto the door and Hermione clasps her hands to her ears. Fred Weasley is injured as Hermione and Ron distressed stand a little way behind Harry. It is still dark and pockets of fire burn throughout the school and grounds as the three friends make their way back up the path to the courtyard. Ron pushes open the doors of the Great Hall and the three are confronted by piles of rubble. Further in they see students and staff. two students carry someone out on a stretcher. Ron spots something and hurries forward with Hermione following while Harry stands frozen in the doorway. Slughorn is tending to the wounded Filch and turns. Harry passes a long line of people being treated witnessing Professor Trelawney and Padma. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Professor McGonagall limps towards Harry who without seeing her turns and strides out of the Great Hall. He enters Dumbledore's old undamaged office as he steps further in covered doors to his right open of their own accord and a stone pedestal slides out. Harry crosses to the pedestal lifts out a shallow silver basin and gently spins it through the air. It floats towards the desk at the far side of the room and he follows the spinning Pensieve to the desk where it lands lightly. Lily opens her palm to reveal a daisy growing in it and an equally young Severus. Snape emerges from a large tree trunk as Petunia runs off.

Harry removes the phial from Snape's cheek grips it as Snape studies Harry's face. Harry's lips tremble Snape's eyes glaze over and his head lolls to one side. Lily opens her palm to reveal a daisy growing in it and an equally young Severus. Snape emerges from a large tree trunk as Petunia runs off.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: With one paw, Max blocks the trickle of honey from Oliver's paw and presses the jug to Oliver's paw, gathering droplets in it. Max pulls the jug from Oliver's paw, clutches it, as Oliver studies Max's face. Max's toes twitch, Oliver's nose fogs over, and his head droops to one side. Grace briefly peers at Leo, then peers down at the carpet. Max gazes at the silent Oliver as the top of the pond starts to ripple and the tower shudders. Max braces against the brick pillar, while Leo clutches the window and Grace covers her eyes with her hands. George Thompson is limping as Grace and Leo, flustered, stand a little way behind Max. It's still dawn, and patches of smoke hover throughout the village and fields as the three companions make their way back up the path to the square. Leo swings open the gates of the Sanctuary, and the three are faced by mounds of stones. Further inside, they notice villagers and elders; two villagers pull someone off on a cart. Leo notices something and scurries forward with Grace trailing, while Max remains fixed in the entrance. Nelson is caring for the exhausted Kyle and swivels. Max moves along a lengthy queue of people receiving attention, observing Miss Stitch and Violet Groom drag a cloth over a silent figure. He observes the Thompsons ahead, with Frank sobbing, gripping his uncle, and desperately embracing Leo. Sophie consoles Jim, and Martha, forlorn, kneels beside George’s figure, brushing his fur. Leo approaches her, crying hopelessly while Grace stands at a distance. Max observes the mourning group and glances to his left, noticing the forms of Luna and Hector lying side by side on carts, Hector's thumb resting on hers. Doctor Brighton shuffles towards Max, who, without noticing her, swivels and paces out of the Sanctuary. He steps into Merlin's former, untouched lounge; as he moves further inside, wooden panels to his right shift of their own will and a marble column glides out. Max approaches the column, draws out a shallow gold dish, and tenderly rotates it through the room. It drifts towards the table at the far edge of the chamber, and he trails the rotating Panorama to the table where it settles gently. Holding the jug containing Oliver's droplets, Max removes the lid and empties the substance into the dish, causing misty white spirals to form in the Panorama. Max dips his brow into the dish, and the twisting white fades to display a field with two small kittens, Emily and her sister Daisy, facing each other. Emily opens her claw to show a tulip growing in it, and an equally young Oliver Creeper appears from a towering bush as Daisy scampers away.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry tries to save Snape, catching his tears in a phial before Snape dies. Amid chaos, with Hogwarts in ruins and Fred Weasley injured, Harry, Ron, and Hermione return to the Great Hall, finding staff and students among rubble. Distressed, the Weasleys mourn Fred, with George clinging to their father and Molly kneeling by Fred's body. Harry notices the bodies of Nymphadora and Remus together. Departing silently, Harry enters Dumbledore's office and uses Snape's tears in the Pensieve. He views a memory of young Lily and Petunia, with a young Severus Snape emerging from a tree, revealing the past connection between them.
